description.narrative: This project paper seeks the approval of the Executive Directors to provide an additional to the Socialist Republic of Vietnam for the component three - post-disaster reconstruction support of the Vietnam Natural Disaster Risk Management Project. The additional credit will scale up the current project by helping: (a) fill a substantial post-disaster reconstruction financing gap in the wake of two recent storms, storm Ketsana and storm Miriniae; and (b) further anticipated short-term reconstruction financing gaps resulting from future major natural disasters in Vietnam. The additional financing will be used to provide support for post-disaster reconstruction in Vietnam under component three of the parent project. Component three aims to reduce a financing gap in public resources available to fund post-disaster reconstruction costs associated with natural disasters, to strengthen government speed and efficiency in the allocation and disbursement of post-disaster resources and enhance effectiveness of public resource utilization. The operational manual has been updated to guide the additional finance implementation. The additional financing will be used to support reconstruction of basic local public structures including schools, health clinics, roads, bridges, water and sewerage infrastructure, pumping stations, canals, etc.

condition.narrative: Engage a damage assessment specialist to assist MOF and Project provinces in implementation of Component 3
Engage an independent monitoring entity to carry out annual technical evaluation of all eligible Post-Disaster Reconstruction
prepare and provide to IDA for review a plan for monitoring and evaluation of the implementation of the project

title.narrative: Central Committee for Flood and Storm Control including its Disaster Management Center has been strengthened

baseline.value: Weak capacity of central and provincial agencies in formulating strategic plans toward disaster risk management investments

comment.narrative: The project provided series of training on different subjects relating to disaster risk management to staff members of GOV lineministries who are also members of CCFSC and provinces

target.value: CCFSC and DMC fully functional and effective.

actual.value: The functions, responsibilities and coordination mechanism of the CCFSC and its branches in the provinces have been establishedthrough the PM's Decree No. 14 issued in February 2010. CCFC has been effectively facilitating the coordinated effort for theimplementaiton of the National Strategy at the national and the provincial level. In particular, CCFSC was effective for 2008-2011storms including Typhoon Nargis, Ilke (2008), Kestana (2009), Floods in the central Vietnam (2009, 2010), and the floods in theMekong Delta(2011). DMC was established in early 2010, and plays a key role for preparedness and resilience in Vietnam. DMC isalso responsible for implementing the National CBDRM Program. They are responsible for implementing a CBDRM component for a followup VN ManagingNatural Hazards Project.

title.narrative: (i) Procedures for Damage Assessment are revised; (ii) Measurable criteria approved for prioritizing allocation of post-disaster assistanceDetailed needs assessment for the establishment of an Eme

target.value: (i) Procedures for Damage Assessment are revised; (ii) Measurable criteria approved for prioritizing allocation of post-disasterassistance.

comment.narrative: Work related to the second indicator has been started and will be completed in December, 2013.

title.narrative: Length of time from the date of release of funds to the relevant provinces to completion of sub-projects;

comment.narrative: A consultant has been carrying a review of the current practices and procedures for the post disaster reconstruction. It'sexpectedthat the first draft report will be circulated by end of November to relevant agencies at national and subnational levelsand the Bank for review. The consultant's finding and recommendations will be presented at the AF Completion Workshop in December

title.narrative: Detailed needs assessment for the establishment of an Emergency Management Center completed

comment.narrative: A detailed needs assessment for the establishment of an Emergency Management Center completed was. Instead of establishing theEmergency Management Center, government established a department level Disaster Management Centre (DMC) in early 2010. DMC is apart of the CCFSC's Standing Office that is responsible for DRM including emergency response and relief

title.narrative: Number of Safer Commune Plans prepared

target.value: 30 communes who are disaster prone have completed the preparation of Safer Commune Plans.

actual.value: 30 Safer Commune Plans have been prepared and implemented, including the construction of the key identified mitigationinfrastructure, training and appointment of disaster management facilitators. The plan has been proven effective for 2009, 2010,and 2011 typhoons/floods. The Safer Commune Plans have been updated by the communes themselves.

title.narrative: Number of feasibility studies completed for sub-subprojects to be funded under the programNumber of sub-projects completed

target.value: 13 feasibility studies completed and to be funded by the project.

actual.value: 3 feasibilities of subproject have been completed. Detailed design has also been completed and investments completed for 12subprojects; the remaining one (hydromet equipment) is underway.

title.narrative: Percentage of people in targeted communities (e.g. Mekong Delta) reporting improved early warning of floods and storms

target.value: 100% of project communes are accessible to early warning of floods and storms.

comment.narrative: the hydromet system functional and target met.

actual.value: 100 percent of the project communes received training and equipment for the early warning system. However, delay in theprocurement of the hydromet for the Mekong delta has resulted in delay in providing accurate and reliable forecast to the concernedcommunities

comment.narrative: Substantially met the target. As the installation of the hydromet equipment has been completed after the project completion, thetarget would be met fully eventually.

title.narrative: Number of provinces with completed Natural Disaster Mititgation Investment Plans

target.value: 12 provincial integrated NDRM investment planning are prepared and being implemented.

actual.value: he integrated NDRM Investment Plan of 12 provinces has been implemented since it was started in 2009. The implementation includes(i) integration with the provincial Socio-Economic Development Plan, (ii) Raising public awareness on DRM, construction ofcriticaldisaster protection structures, etc. Identified investments are being implemented by the provincial budget partly with thefinancialsupports from development partners including the Bank.

title.narrative: The Vietnamese Government establishes and implements a comprehensive disaster risk management framework for natural disaster prevention, preparedness, mitigation and recovery.

baseline.value: Referred to the Government Strategy and Action Plan for Mitigating Water Disaster was prepared and adopted in 1994.

target.value: The strategy, including its implementation plan and the CBDRM program are approved, and being implemented

actual.value: The Government approved the Action Plan for implementation of the National Strategy for DRM in 2009, and is implementing it. Inaddition, the National CBDRM Program was approved in 2009 by Prime Minister and is being rolled out in about 6,000 disastervulnerable communes cross the country.

title.narrative: Percentage of completed sub-projects withstanding subsequent disaster events of the same type of hazard up to the intensity of a 1-in-30 year event

comment.narrative: There were no damageto the reconstructured public infrastructure after the recent typhoon Wutip, Nari and Haiyan in 2013
